acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 2 from 48 hours EC50=1.8mg/L of the crustacea (Daphnia magna) (Environmental Agency eco-toxicity tests of chemicals (2000)).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Classification is not possible because there is no data. In addition, EU classification of 3,4-Dichloroaniline (CAS No.95-76-1) which is a constitutional isomer is T;23/24/25 (EU-Annex I).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Classification is not possible because there is no data. In addition, EU classification of 3,4-Dichloroaniline (CAS No.95-76-1) which is a constitutional isomer is T;23/24/25 (EU-Annex I).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Since it was a solid by the definition of GHS and inhalation in gas was not assumed, it was classified into "Not applicable".

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: From LD50 value 1,600 mg/kg of the oral administration test employing a rat (HSDB (2003)), it was classified into Category 4. In addition, EU classification of 3,4-Dichloroaniline (CAS No.95-76-1) which is a constitutional isomer is T;23/24/25 (EU-Annex I).

aspiration_hazard.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

carcinogenicity.rationale: Since no evaluation by major international evaluation agencies is made and there is no data, classification is not possible.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since acute toxicity was Category 2 and there were no rapid degradability (not readily degradable, the decomposition by BOD(standard test method (2 weeks)): 0% (Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data (1979)), it was classified into Category 2.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available.

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

flammable_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Although there are descriptions of "negative" in the in vitro reverse mutation test employing Salmonella typhimurium (NTP DB (Access on January 2009)) and "negative" in chromosome aberration test employing V79 cell and in the UDS test employing hepatic cells (BUA 140 (Summary, 1993)), classification is not possible because there is no data of in vivo examination. In addition, also refer to the classification of 3,4-Dichloroaniline (CAS No.95-76-1) which is a constitutional isomer.

organic_peroxides.rationale: The organic compound not including peroxy group in molecule.

oxidizing_solids.rationale: It is an organic compound not containing oxygen, fluorine or chlorine.

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Even if it contacts the normal temperature air, it does not ignite spontaneously (ignition temperature 540degC (IUCLID,2000)).

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Although there is a description as follows in SIDS (2005), "In the short-term repeated study with 2-chloroaniline and 2,5-Dichloroaniline no effect was found on male genital organs, " classification is not possible, because there is no other datum.

respiratory_sensitizer.rationale: Classification is not possible since there is no data.

self_heating_substances.rationale: The test method applicable for substances becoming liquid or gas at 140degC of test temperature has not been established.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: From the description of "The effect which is severe and is not completely recovered on the eyes of a rabbit" (BUA 140 (Summary, 1993)), it was classified into Category 1. In addition, the EU classification of 3,4-Dichloroaniline, which is a constitutional isomer, is Xi; R41 (CAS No.95-76-1) (EU-Annex I).

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Although there is a description, saying, "It is not an irritating substance against rabbit's skin,"(BUA 140 (Summary, 1993)), classification is not possible because data are insufficient.

skin_sensitizer.hazard_statement: May cause an allergic skin reaction
skin_sensitizer.rationale: The substance was classified as Category 1 from descriptions that "it is a methemoglobin formation substance, and indicates weak skin sensitizing potential" (Patty (5th, 2001)) and that "bad skin sensitizing potential" (BUA 140 (Summary 1993)) in the Maximization tests employing guinea pig. In addition, 3,4-Dichloroaniline (CAS No.95-76-1) which are constitutional isomers can be classified as R43 (EU-AnnexI) in the European Union classification.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At) are not included.

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (blood system)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: There are reports of "hemolytic anemia and elevated total bilirubin levels, and in females, increased erythrocyte production in the bone marrow and hemosiderosis in the lien in males of 150 and 750 mg/kg dose groups in a 28-day oral administration study in rats," and "3,4-, 2,4- and 2,5-Dichloroaniline are methemoglobin-forming substances" in EU-RAR (2006), so it was classified as Category 2 (blood system).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs (blood system)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: The information source of List1 have a description that "3,4-, 2,4-, 2,5-Dichloroaniline are methemoglobin formation substances" (EU-RAR (2006)). Moreover, the information source of List2 has a description that "cyanosis, a feeling of fatigue, dyspnea, and a muscular power fall were shown as acute symptoms by methemoglobinemia" (BUA 140 (Summary, 1993)), and another description that "the effect by increases of methemoglobin values and decrease of transport an blood oxygen rate is reported" (HSDB (2003)), therefore, it classified into Category 2 (blood systems). In addition, ICSC (2000) has a description that "this article may affect blood by effect of the methemoglobin formation."
